moves.1. e4 e6 2. d4 Qf6: A rather quiet first move for Black, but this second move is rather curious.  Interesting.
moves.3. Be3 d5: An attempt to prosecute a delayed attack.
moves.4. e5 Qe7 5. c4: An attempt to press forward and gain superiority over a more open center.
moves.5... Qb4+ 6. Qd2 Qb6: Defeats the aggressive alternative 6...dxc4, beaten by 7. a3 Qb6 8.Bxc4.
moves.7. a3 c6 8. b4 g6: Black has missed White's bridge to be built, attacking the Queen.
moves.9. c5: White has a strong queenside position, attacking Black and getting a good stonewall position far into Black's side of the board.
moves.9... Qc7 10. f4 Nh6 11. Be2 Qe7 12. g4 Q: White has made a small mistake and now stands to lose a pawn.
moves.13. Bf2 Qe7: Black is arguably incompetent and misses a good chance, allowing White to continue on the offensive.
moves.14. g5 Nf5 15. Nc3 Bg7 16. Nf3 O-O: Black has few good attacks and really ought to shore up his defense, but instead moves his king to a place which is not well defended.
moves.17. Nh4 Na6 18. Nxf5 exf5: Black's dinking around has allowed White to clear off Black's pesky knight.
moves.19. h4 Bd7 20. h5 gxh5 21. Rxh5: Now we can see the writing on the wall.  Nonetheless, 21...h6 would force 22.gxh6 Bxh6 23. Rxh6 Kg7 forcing a retreat and allowing for some possible Black action to save a draw.
moves.21... b5: What in God's name is Black doing, anyway?
moves.22. O-O-O Nc7 23. Rdh1: Not quite Alekhine's gun, but a strong attack on
moves.23... Ne6 24. Rh5xh7 f6: The first good move Black's made.
moves.25. gxf6: Probably the best line for Black is 25...Qe8 16. fxg7 Nxg7 and the game is not totally lost.
moves.25... Qf7: Instead Black pins his king in.
moves.26. fxg7 Nxg7: Even there, capturing with the Queen was essential.
moves.27. Rh7h8#: I think the game speaks for itself.
